content:
EXISTING STRUCTURES
No new structures have been successfully established on the map. Multiple attempts were made to supply a Lab (intended to receive Automation Science Packs for advancing research) at position (0.5, 2.5), but placement or crafting failed due to inventory and resource issues. Existing furnaces used for smelting were referenced but not newly created as map structures.

ERROR TIPS
• Incorrect API Calls for Entity Retrieval
 – Calling get_entities with unsupported keywords (e.g. using a 'radius' parameter) or an incorrect number of positional arguments causes TypeErrors. Use the correct function signature and parameter order.
• Lab Placement and Inventory Verification
 – Failures to place the Lab arise when there is no lab available in inventory. Verify and ensure that the necessary Lab item is present before attempting placement.
• Handling None Values in Entity Retrieval
 – When get_entities returns None, iterating over the result leads to a TypeError. Implement a check or fallback to an empty list to avoid iterating a NoneType.
• Insufficient Resources for Lab Crafting
 – Lab crafting repeatedly fails due to missing sub-ingredients (e.g. iron-gear-wheels, electronic circuits, copper cables) caused by shortages in primary resources like iron plates and copper plates. Ensure that all prerequisite smelting and production steps are completed and that sufficient resources are available before retrying lab crafting.
